The Football Transfer Sources Reliability Guide

Football Transfer Source Reliability Tiers

Tier 1 – Almost undisputed when discussing a Transfer Rumour. They may not be the first to discuss a rumour, but if they are talking about it; then it is almost certainly true, and possibly close to complete.
Tier 2 – Known to have current sources, but are still fallible and just short of being considered an authority on rumour discussions. However, multiple individuals or sources from this tier reporting the same rumour may indicate a strong possibility of truth to the rumour.
Tier 3 – Unreliable, and not to be trusted solo. They fall into near click-bait practices and are often fighting for relevance in a sea of rumours.
Tier 4 – Not to be trusted at all. These companies make money out of ensuring that you read them and they will make up anything to get you to harness advertising revenue.
Tier 5 – Don’t waste your time reading them




(credit: false 9)

Verona close deal for Udinese's Lasagna: the details

The deal with Verona is closed on a loan with fee with a fixed purchase obligation of €6.5m which is activated by certain milestone, plus €2.5m in bonuses for a total fee of €9m.

Udinese is considering his replacement and are looking to move quickly to add Llorente and Cutrone in a double purcahse from Napoli and Wolves.

本田圭佑投葡超護級隊

【Now Sports】34歲日本中場本田圭佑落實加盟葡超球隊樸迪莫倫斯，簽約6個月，完約後可選擇是否延長1年合約。

本田圭佑（Honda Keisuke）離開巴甲保地花高後，落實加盟葡超球隊樸迪莫倫斯，合約至今季完結。將披上新東家4號球衣的本田圭佑表示：「感謝球會邀請，很高興來到這裡。我考慮是否加盟已1個月，最終選擇來到這家球會。轉會對我最有利，很高興迎來艱辛挑戰，希望能交出符合球員身份的表現。」

樸迪莫倫斯目前排在葡超倒數第4的15位，陣中另有2名日本球員，分別是同為25歲的後衛安西幸輝及門將中村航輔。

Ajax and Spartak Moscow reach agreement for Quincy Promes


Ajax has reached an agreement with Spartak Moscow for the direct transfer of Quincy Promes. The forward’s move to the Russian club is subject to a medical examination. The Football Transfer Sources Reliability Guide

Football Transfer Source Reliability Tiers

Tier 1 – Almost undisputed when discussing a Transfer Rumour. They may not be the first to discuss a rumour, but if they are talking about it; then it is almost certainly true, and possibly close to complete.
Tier 2 – Known to have current sources, but are still fallible and just short of being considered an authority on rumour discussions. However, multiple individuals or sources from this tier reporting the same rumour may indicate a strong possibility of truth to the rumour.
Tier 3 – Unreliable, and not to be trusted solo. They fall into near click-bait practices and are often fighting for relevance in a sea of rumours.
Tier 4 – Not to be trusted at all. These companies make money out of ensuring that you read them and they will make up anything to get you to harness advertising revenue.
Tier 5 – Don’t waste your time reading them
